Ig睇到 原來華斯基有試過叫高普返嚟教

Borussia Dortmund CEO Hans-Joachim Watzke has revealed Jurgen Klopp was offered the chance to quit Liverpool and return to the club after the Reds’ Champions League defeat to Real Madrid.
The German moved to Anfield in October 2015, a few months after leaving Dortmund, with his current contract on Merseyside not expiring until 2023.
But that did not prevent Watzke from offering Klopp the chance to return to the club he’s revealed in his new book ‘REAL LOVE. A life with BVB’.
"I knew that Jurgen would [decline], that he will fulfil his contract in Liverpool.
Jurgen has always fulfilled his contracts, but if you want to go new ways and we had to break new ground at BVB, then at least I had to ask Jurgen if he could possibly imagine that.
I did not expect that at all, but I would not have forgiven myself for not asking him at that moment."
_______
Recalling the phone-call himself, Klopp has revealed Liverpool were never in any danger of losing their manager.
"At some point my phone rang while I was on the plane and Aki was on it: ‘Jurgen, you have to come back’. I laughed, I thought he was kidding.
Are you stupid, have you been drinking? How do you get that idea, I have a few more years in Liverpool’.
I do not know how serious he was at that moment, but I realised that he wanted me to be more willing to respond."

"I knew that Jurgen would [decline], that he will fulfil his contract in Liverpool.
Jurgen has always fulfilled his contracts, but if you want to go new ways and we had to break new ground at BVB, then at least I had to ask Jurgen if he could possibly imagine that.
I did not expect that at all, but I would not have forgiven myself for not asking him at that moment."
_______
Recalling the phone-call himself, Klopp has revealed Liverpool were never in any danger of losing their manager.
"At some point my phone rang while I was on the plane and Aki was on it: ‘Jurgen, you have to come back’. I laughed, I thought he was kidding.
Are you stupid, have you been drinking? How do you get that idea, I have a few more years in Liverpool’.
I do not know how serious he was at that moment, but I realised that he wanted me to be more willing to respond."
